pageContext.claim: “Well, we had the magic wand, because we have almost 600,000 manufacturing jobs since the election, and it's going to go much, much higher than that.”
pageContext.analysis: U.S. manufacturing employment has been increasing at a steady rate since 2010.  The Bureau of Labor Statistics in August revised the figure downward. As of October, 389,000 manufacturing jobs had been added since Trump became president, indicating the president’s tariff war was taking a toll on manufacturing.
